description.title: Weekly Goals
description.description: Each week, steadily improve accuracy and reasoning in both Math and Reading & Writing by reducing repeat mistakes and deepening mastery of prioritized skills. Aim to stabilize performance under timed conditions, minimize score variance, and build endurance for full-length tests. Track measurable progress through consistent score improvements and refined problem-solving strategies, reinforcing confidence and mental control.

description.title: Reading & Writing
description.description: Command of Evidence - Quantitative, Text Structure and Purpose, Central Ideas and Details, Inferences, Cross-text Connections

description.title: Math
description.description: Area and volume, One-variable data: Distributions and measures of center and spread, Right triangles and trigonometry, Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units

description.Command of Evidence - Quantitative: Practice interpreting embedded quantitative data by working through SAT-style passages with charts and tables, under timed conditions, highlighting key numbers and paraphrasing their meaning to strengthen evidence linkage and avoid misinterpretation.
description.Text Structure and Purpose: Analyze complex passages by identifying signal words and outlining text organization, then write brief summaries explaining the authorâ€™s purpose to master difficult question types and improve speed under timed practice.
description.Central Ideas and Details: After reading each passage, pause to annotate main ideas and supporting details, then summarize in your own words to reinforce foundational understanding and improve accuracy on central idea questions.
description.Inferences: Engage with medium-difficulty inference questions by annotating clues and tone shifts in passages, then justify your answers by linking explicit text evidence with logical conclusions to strengthen core inference skills.
description.Cross-text Connections: Practice paired passage exercises focusing on identifying relationships between texts, using graphic organizers to map similarities and differences, thereby building foundational skills in cross-text analysis.

description.Area and volume: Tackle challenging problems involving composite figures and three-dimensional solids by drawing diagrams, applying formulas carefully, and verifying units to refine advanced problem-solving techniques.
description.One-variable data: Distributions and mea: Work through medium-difficulty exercises calculating mean, median, range, and IQR from data sets, interpreting histograms and box plots to identify distribution shape and outliers accurately.
description.Right triangles and trigonometry: Solve complex right triangle problems by labeling sides relative to angles, using trigonometric ratios and inverse functions, and checking answers for reasonableness to deepen mastery of advanced applications.
description.Ratios, rates, proportional relationship: Practice multi-step problems combining ratios, proportions, and unit conversions, carefully setting up equations and tracking units to build confidence in handling challenging real-world scenarios.

description.title: Weekly Structure
description.description: Each weekday includes focused dual-skill practice sessions pairing one Math and one Reading & Writing skill, starting the week with weakest skills to prioritize improvement, midweek focusing on moderate skills, and Fridays dedicated to comprehensive review of errors and strategy refinement. Saturdays feature two full-length practice tests simulating real exam conditions to build endurance and confidence, followed by detailed mistake analysis. Sundays serve as a Flex Day for rest and adaptive activities aligned with personal growth.

description.title: Flex Day Activities
description.description: Engage in low-pressure reflection by reviewing errors from the week and journaling insights on what strategies worked and what needs adjustment. Experiment with new study tools or alternate problem-solving approaches to foster adaptability. Participate in mixed-skill challenges to maintain cognitive flexibility without intensity. Incorporate mindfulness or light physical activity to recharge mentally and physically. Set clear, achievable goals for the upcoming week to maintain motivation and a sense of progress.
